HTML.Question: What symbol indicates that a tag is a closing tag?
HTML.Explanation: The </tag name> indicates the end of a tag. For example, </body> This tag signifies the end of the body of the document. </html> This tag signifies the end of the html document.

HTML.Question: Which of the following is an opening tag for a list that is made up of bullet points?
HTML.Explanation: Unordered HTML List An unordered list starts with the <ul> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.

HTML.Question: The formal term for placing something inside of something else.
HTML.Explanation:
HTML elements can be nested (this means that elements can contain other elements).
All HTML documents consist of nested HTML elements.

HTML.Question: What tag put "Learn to code" at the top of the browser tab?
HTML.Explanation: An unordered list starts with the <ul> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.

HTML.Question: The <h3> heading will make text that is bigger than the <h5> heading.
HTML.Explanation:
The <h1> to <h6> tags are used to define HTML headings.
<h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.

HTML.Question: What tag is missing from the code below?
HTML.Explanation: The Tag It is called a self-closing tag, which means that there is just a slash at the end of the opening tag

HTML.Question: What is the function of this tag?: <a href>
HTML.Explanation:
The HTML <a> href Attribute is used to specify the URL of the page that the link goes to. When the href attribute is not present in the <a> an element that it will not be a hyperlink.
This attribute is used to specify a link to any address. This attribute is used along with <a> tag.
Syntax:
<a href="URL">

HTML.Question: Which of the following is NOT an attribute?
HTML.Explanation: HTML attributes are special words used inside the opening tag to control the element's behaviour. HTML attributes are a modifier of an HTML element type.

HTML.Question: To change the background of your HTML document, which tag should be modified?
HTML.Explanation: The HTML <body> tag defines the main content of the HTML document that will be directly visible on your web page. This tag contains the other tags of the HTML document. So, any change on it will affect the whole HTML document.

HTML.Question: Which of the following is correct? (to begin the image code)
Which of these is a self-closing tag? (empty tag)
HTML.Explanation: A Self-closing tag is a special form of start tag with a slash immediately before the closing right angle bracket. These indicate that the element is to be closed immediately, and has no content.

HTML.Question: HTML is the meaning or:
HTML.Explanation: HyperText Markup Language (HTML) is the set of markup symbols or codes inserted into a file intended for display on the Internet. The markup tells web browsers how to display a web page's words and images.

HTML.Question: The html code at the very top of an HTML file:
HTML.Explanation:
All HTML documents must start with a <!DOCTYPE> declaration.
The declaration is not an HTML tag. It is an "information" to the browser about what document type to expect.

CSS.Question: What is CSS term is right before the colon?  EXAMPLE:      p { font-size: 10pt; }
CSS.Explanation: A CSS rule consists of a CSS selector and a set of CSS properties. The CSS selector determines what HTML elements to target with the CSS rule. The CSS properties specifies what to style of the targeted HTML elements.

CSS.Question: Which CSS property is used to change font color?
CSS.Explanation:
The color property specifies the color of text.
Eg, h1 {color: #00ff00;}

CSS.Question: CSS stands for...
CSS.Explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets · CSS describes how HTML elements are to be displayed on screen, paper, or in other media

CSS.Question: What symbol is this code missing?
What symbol is missing from the following code?
The link to your CSS file belongs in what section of your HTML file?
CSS.Explanation: You can link this external file (. css file) to your HTML document file using the < link > tag . You can place this < link > tag Within the < head > section, and after the < title > element of your HTML file

CSS.Question: Code used to link CSS file to html file:
CSS.Explanation:
CSS can be added to HTML documents in 3 ways:
Inline - by using the style attribute inside HTML elements.
Internal - by using a <style> element in the <head> section.
External - by using a <link> element to link to an external CSS file.

CSS.Question: CSS styles consist of the format:
CSS.Explanation: Every CSS declaration includes a property / value pair. Depending on the property, the value can include a single integer or keyword, to a series of keywords and values with or without units.

CSS.Question: CSS property used to center text:
Prefix for a hex number color value:
CSS.Explanation: Well, "hex color codes" is another way of saying "hexadecimal color codes" or "​hexadecimal values". The format is a hash (#) followed by 6 numbers or letters.

CSS.Question: Hex code characters range from the number 0 to the letter:
CSS.Explanation:
Hexadecimal color values are also supported in all browsers.
A hexadecimal color is specified with: #RRGGBB.
RR (red), GG (green) and BB (blue) are hexadecimal integers between 00 and FF specifying the intensity of the color.
For example, #0000FF is displayed as blue, because the blue component is set to its highest value (FF) and the others are set to 00.

CSS.Question: CSS uses HTML tags or _________to style an element:
CSS.Explanation: Selector is a pattern of elements and other terms that tell the browser which HTML elements should be selected to have the CSS property values inside the rule applied to them. The element or elements which are selected by the selector are referred to as the subject of the selector.

CSS.Question: CSS script that underlines text:
CSS.Explanation:
The text-decoration property specifies the decoration added to text, and is a shorthand property for
text-decoration-line (required)
text-decoration-color
text-decoration-style

CSS.Question: CSS style that inserts attributes into individual tags:
CSS.Explanation:
An inline style may be used to apply a unique style for a single element.
To use inline styles, add the style attribute to the relevant element. The style attribute can contain any CSS property.

CSS.Question: CSS colors can take the form of all except:
CSS.Explanation:
The <color> CSS data type represents a color.
There are several different ways to specify colors in CSS:
Color Keywords
RGB
RGBA
HSL
HSLA
Hexadecimal

CSS.Question: Which would be an appropriate property/value pair for styling the h2 selector?
CSS script to make only the first letter of every word uppercase:
CSS.Explanation: capitalize Puts the first character of each word in uppercase; other characters are unaffected.

CSS.Question: The property used to specify a certain font and its alternative options is:
CSS.Explanation: The font-family property specifies a list of fonts, from highest priority to lowest

JS.Question: What does NOT create a valid function myFunc ?
Inside which element do we put the JavaScript
JS.Explanation: The <script> tag is used to contain javascript code.

JS.Question:
What is the correct JavaScript syntax to change the content of the HTML element below?

This is a demostration
JS.Explanation:
The getElementById() method returns the element that has the ID attribute with the specified value. This method is one of the most common methods in the HTML DOM, and is used almost every time you want to manipulate, or get info from, an element on your document.
The innerHTML property sets or returns the HTML content (inner HTML) of an element.

JS.Question: What is the correct syntax for referring to an external script called "xxx.js"?
JS.Explanation: The src attribute specifies the URL of an external script file.

JS.Question: How do you write "Hello World" in an alert box?
JS.Explanation:
Alert box is often used if you want to make sure information comes through to the user.
It's syntax is window.alert("sometext"); Nevertheless, window can be ommited

JS.Question: How do you call a function named "myFunction"?
JS.Explanation:
To call this function, you simply call it directly by name, then pass in the parameter value.
Eg, myFunction()

JS.Question: How to write an IF statement in JavaScript?
How to write an IF statement for executing some code if "i" is NOT equal to 5?
JS.Explanation:
Use if to specify a block of code to be executed, if a specified condition is true. 
The syntax is 
The not equal operator is !=

JS.Question: How does a FOR loop start?
How does a WHILE loop start?
How to insert a comment that has more than one line?
JS.Explanation:
JavaScript comments can be used to explain JS code, to make it more readable and to prevent execution, when testing alternative code.
Single comment //
Multiple comment /* */
JS.Correct answer: /*This comment has more than one line*/
JS.Incorrect answer 1: //This comment has more than one line//
JS.Incorrect answer 2: <!--This comment has more than one line-->
JS.Incorrect answer 3: */This comment has more than one line*/

JS.Question: What is the correct way to write a JavaScript array?
JS.Explanation:
JavaScript arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable. Its syntax is:
var array_name = [item1, item2, ...];

JS.Question: How do you round the number 7.25, to the nearest integer?
JS.Explanation:
The round() method rounds a number to the nearest integer. Its syntax is:
Math.round(number)

JS.Question: How do you find the number with the highest value of x and y?
JS.Explanation:
The max() method returns the number with the highest value. Its syntax is:
Math.max(n1, n2, n3, ..., nX)

JS.Question: Which event occurs when the user clicks on an HTML element?
JS.Explanation: The onclick event occurs when the user clicks on an element.

JS.Question: How do you declare a JavaScript variable?
JS.Explanation:
There are 3 ways to declare a JavaScript variable:
Using var
Using let
Using const

JS.Question: Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable?
What will the following code return: Boolean(10 > 9)
JS.Explanation:
Boolean data type can only take the values true or false. It is used to find out if an expression (or a variable) is true or false.
In this case 10 is greatter than 9. So it will return true.

JS.Question: How can you detect the client's browser name?
JS.Explanation: The appName property returns the application name of the browser
